title: The State of Generosity in 2024–2025: Generosity as Resilience
author: GivingTuesday Data Commons

widget_viz-library_items.title: Overview of Generosity by Type of Gift: Money, Items, and Volunteering (Kenya)
author: GivingTuesday Data Commons
widget_viz-library_items.desc: This Venn diagram reveals Kenya's remarkable giving behavior, where 90% of respondents participate in all three activities: giving money, donating items, and volunteering. This represents the highest overlap among all countries studied. Single-activity engagement is extremely minimal, with only 3% engaging in money and item donations combined, and tiny percentages for other combinations. Kenya demonstrates unprecedented universal engagement across all forms of charitable giving and community support.

custom_fields.source: The State of Generosity in 2024–2025: Generosity as Resilience

widget_viz-library_items.title: Overview of Generosity by Type of Gift: Money, Items, and Volunteering (Mexico)
author: GivingTuesday Data Commons
widget_viz-library_items.desc: This Venn diagram shows Mexico's giving patterns, where 37% of respondents engage in all three charitable activities: giving money, donating items, and volunteering. Mexico displays 20% participation in item giving only, with 18% combining money and item donations. The country shows balanced engagement across different giving methods, with 15% participating in both item donations and volunteering. Mexico demonstrates diversified charitable engagement with moderate overlap between different giving approaches.

custom_fields.source: The State of Generosity in 2024–2025: Generosity as Resilience

widget_viz-library_items.title: Overview of Generosity by Type of Gift: Money, Items, and Volunteering (United Kingdom)
author: GivingTuesday Data Commons
widget_viz-library_items.desc: This Venn diagram illustrates the United Kingdom's giving behavior, where 39% of respondents participate in all three charitable activities: giving money, donating items, and volunteering. The UK shows 27% engaging in combined money and item giving, representing strong financial charitable engagement. Additionally, 14% focus exclusively on item donations, while 9% concentrate only on monetary giving. The UK demonstrates substantial integration between monetary and material charitable contributions with significant comprehensive engagement.

custom_fields.source: The State of Generosity in 2024–2025: Generosity as Resilience

widget_viz-library_items.title: Overview of Generosity by Type of Gift: Money, Items, and Volunteering (United States)
author: GivingTuesday Data Commons
widget_viz-library_items.desc: This Venn diagram displays US giving patterns, where 39% of respondents engage in all three charitable activities: giving money, donating items, and volunteering. The US shows 23% participating in combined money and item giving, with 17% focusing exclusively on item donations. Additionally, 9% engage in both item giving and volunteering, while 6% concentrate solely on monetary donations. The US demonstrates balanced engagement across multiple charitable pathways with strong overlap between different giving methods.

custom_fields.source: The State of Generosity in 2024–2025: Generosity as Resilience
